So, it's literally been ages since I've used this thing and I'm not quite sure anyone still reads it.  I'm just chilling at work until I have to do phone teaching and one of my students asked if I had a blog and I first answered no and then decided why not write something and see if anyone actually still reads it.

Good times, there are so many things I could write about.  I guess I still can't believe I've been in Korea for over 5 months.  It's an experience to say the least.  Well I hope all is well with whoever reads this and if you actually comment- I might end up writting more.

Lots of love from the other side of the world.

XXXX Kelly

I once again will update this thing considering I don't do it that often.  My life is going good- still working on the job situation but I'm sure everything will work itself out in the end.  I guess why I'm really posting to this thing is to talk about a boy....  YOu are prolly thinking- Oh crap, not another bitching post but I pormise you it's not.  I went to Iowa a few weeks back and met a guy who is amazing.  He's funny, cute, and most importantly (well sorta) he made sure I was alright all that night.  I think I drank a little too much.  Since then we've been seeing each other and he will be coming this weekend which is like a 5 hour drive to visit me.  I will meet his Dad on Saturday and I'm pretty sure me, him, mark, and Kelly will go out to eat on Saturday night.  It will be good times had by all.  I don't want to write too much in here but now my friend John is teasing me because this is now the third friend that I have dated- oh well.  Anyways, I miss you guys a lot and I hope I see you before I move to who knows where.  All my love as always~ Kelly

Well, once again I made my way down to the great city of Ames- or is it more so the bunker in that city that makes it amazing?  All I know for sure is that it was a lot of fun for me.  There are no words to describe it and you sorta have to be there too really understand.  There was lots of alcohol and I had the opportunity again to see John and Brianne.  There were other cool people I met down there but I really don't want to go into details on this.

So yeah, life is good and I don't know what else you guys are looking for and you really need to chit chat some other way then just through this thing.  I hope everything is good for you and yours and I'll catch you guys later.

Ok guys- seeing since I am getting posts on my wknd- I was really bummed about the whole situation and I thought LJ was there so you can posts about things like that.  I am sorry if I offended you but everyone has certain feelings whether they are rational or not.  LJ is there so I am able to get the bitch off my mind and move on.  

Ok- but this is a post in response to a few comments that people make that pisses me off.  I'm sure all of you poeople work very hard at grad school butI do try at school and work my butt off as well.  Just because I don't bitch about all the time I spend on homework, and school, doesn't mean I'm worthless and don't do a good job at it.  I have been on the dean's list last december and got a 3.66 this past semester.  I am not one of those people that never do homework and I'm sorry that I have to bitch before you guys think that I do.  I have pulled all nighters and I work my ass off; so don't give me this crap that no one understands how it is to be in college.  I just don't bitch about it because I don't feel the need to bring it up.  So before you go posting away about how your lives suck and how you are so busy-  Don't undermine the rest of the people.  I'm sorry that you guys are busy; but don't mistake that I am able to do things on a few wknds, as meaning that I have an easy courseload.  For those of you that don't know- I am taking two capstone courses.  All of my classes are at least 300 level.  I have 15 credits and I am doing an internship and tutoring and working a desk shift.  I do try to savor my wknds because I work hard during the week and I have been making sacrifices to see people because in the end- that is what matters to me.  I care about my grades and I am making sure that they are not suffering for this.  Currently I am getting at least three A's in my classes and at least an A- in another-= the last class I am not sure but I should at least have a B or better going.  If you want to bitch about what you all have to do, that is your peragative but do not and I reapeat DO NOT ASSUME WHAT I DO BECAUSE I HAVE NOT COMPLAINED ABOUT IT!

Hey guys- 
Once again I am going to post an entry about my wknd before Halloween.  Well as some of you may or may have not known- I went to Chris and Jenn's house in Chanhassen.  It's usually the only house I stay at in the cities- probably because it's the only place that I know how to get to and they are the only people that invite me over.  I'm always up for a weekend spent with friends if anyone a.) invites me, b.) I'm not swamped with homework and c.) enough warning time that I can come.  I say that because it really isn't an invite if you go the day before or on the day you want to see me, invite me.  That is not enough time at all.  

What is sad about going to the cities is that I never seem to see anyone else there.  It's not that I don't want to but something always gets in the way or people find some reason to back out of going out.  Wendy- I do understand that you were unable to make it which sucks- but maybe another time?  I'm not trying to be mean here- but you can't expect people to always come to you when you want to hang out.  That is not an equal tradeoff- so if you choose not to come out- you shouldn't complain that you never see anyone on a regular basis.   With that bitch off my back- I'll continue by saying it was an awesome weekend.

We went out to uptown and I dressed up as a belly dancer- you should have seen my costume- it was hott!  Jenn went as a mime and Chris as a fire crotch- no joking.  Jenn's friend- Nikki went out ande I never really figured out what she was going for.  There were a few others in the group that we went out with and they all seemed to be a lot of fun and have fun.  Although I do have to say that drinks in Mpls are much more expensive then in EC.  I had a good time and some people got my costume while others didn't= even after I showed them the moves- Stupid girls that are blonde!  I did get videotapped by a person and had fans of my moves.  They asked if I really bellydanced or if I just had the costume.  I ended up saying that I could and then demonstrated- that was when they videotapped and clapped loudly- it was a group of about ten.  In case you guys didn't know- I am an attention whore so I absolutely loved it.  I also showed a couple of moves to people that asked me.  All in all, it was a blast even though I froze on the walk to the bars.  It was nice having that extra hour of sleep this morning and I really don't know what else to say here.  Good times as always.

On another note, I am dreading Tuesday- I guess I will see if I'm emotional or not?  I hope I'm not but I never really do know.  For those of you who probably don't know- my mom will have been gone for five years on Tuesday.  That's enough of that- and I will hopefully talk to ya all later.  Peace out.

Blah- it's been a long week and I've been studying for exams it seems nonstop.  My mind is swiss cheese!  Ha- my friend got a good laugh out of that when I said it.  On another note- the relationship I was super excited for is seeming to not be working out for the best.  I do care about this person but right now I don't think it's logical to continue when it will be forever until I see him.  So I think we are going to be in an open relationship or just go back to friends until we are able to see each other more.  I wish he was here because it would be different but maybe it is for the best- lots of things change in a short amount of time and I don't want to hinder my other possibilites nor his.  I'm not actively pursuing anyone at the moment but I'm not opposing the idea either- oh hell- I have fun no matter what and I'm pretty sure he is too.  So yeah, that's whats up with me.  

Other than that, this weekend will be another one well spent with Chris and Jenn- it seems as if I am always visiting them but that is probably because I actually am.  They are fun to be around and I haven't had a bad experience or a disappointment yet when I am with them.  Still working on my halloween costume.  Other than that- I'm planning on going to Iowa State again in November which is super exciting- MARINES!= that is all I really need to write.  I hope all of you guys are happy and I support you in whatever decisions you decide to make.  Oh and I finally got my Deluded t-shirt- and yeas I earned it.  

Take care and hit me back if you are ever in the area!

Once again I'm making a post- I've reviewed my journal the last couple of days.  It was interesting to read what I once wrote and remember what was going on.  Surprising enough, there wasn't as many bitter entries that I once thought there would be. 

 Life is good but that's not a big shocker.  My best friend just came this wknd.  It was an amazing time and I had my first and only person of this semester share my bed- it was hott!  I feel as if I'm different when I'm around her.  I'm happier and I enjoy life like no other.  I also can't stop laughing which is a good thing and needed.  At times it feels like we are in a relationship because we buy each other things and go to each other's houses for the family dinner- good times are always had.  I miss her already and she was just here a day ago.  Oh well, I'm sure I will see her soon.

As for other things, some asshole has my ID and will probably use it to get into bars- grrr.  I hope they get busted- other than that- there isn't anything else I feel like writing now.  Peace Out.

Hey people,

It's been awhile and since you may or may have not have talked to me, here's the update of my life.  Homecoming was for the most part good- although there was drama here and there but that sometimes happens.  I took many pictures and I may or may not be willing to share those with you.  I'm really liking that saying, so bear with me.

I am in a relationship which makes me happy although there are a ton of skeptics out there.  What differece does it make to any of you if I am happy.  Can't you guys just be happy for me?  That is not directed at all of you but it is directed at some of you.

Other things happening is my best friend is coming to visit me this wknd- I can't hardly wait.  She completes me and she'll say the same about me.  I'm never as happy without her as I am with her and I'm planning on having her in my life for a long, long time.  I'm still exercising and doing belly dancing.  I do care about what I look like believe it or not and I think I'm more pleasant when I do these things.  I love to get my dance on- Good times.

Other than that, I don't have much else I want to report on here except always make sure it is alright with someone before you do something that could potentially piss them off and back them into a corner they don't want to be in.  If you guys are good which I know you are- you will be able to figure that one out.

Hey people,

Well me life as of lately is beginning to become more busy as I progess through this semester.  I started my internship which so far is just reviewing what other interns did there before I got there.  It isn't that bad but it seems like I'm stuck there forever.  I also started my other job which is tutoring for economics.  I am actually the only econ tutor this year which is kinda scary.  My office hours are actually being utilized this semester as I have had at least one person come in every hour I worked this week.  The most was three girls at once- it was kinda overwhelming because I think a fourth girl wanted to come in at the same time which I was like- omg- this room is not nearly big enough for that.  Other than that, I'm also working Governors Security once again even though I didn't sign up for it  I figure I could use the extra cash and lately there has been a ton of lobby rats until I leave at three in the morning and they are still there- it kinda reminds me of how we used to roll way back when.

On happy notes, I have once again started my workout program to look amazing- not like it's hard for me.  I have went swiming twice in which each time I have swam at least an hour in laps.  It is so amazing the feeling you get when you are done.  Plus I don't think it's one of those workouts that you sweat and just feel disgusting about.  Oh, and me and Reyna are now going to belly dancing lessons- I'm so excited!!!!!  We barely got in and just by mere presence and persistence- we were allowed in.  It was crazy but we were both increadibly happy.

Other then that- I"m going home this weekend to say goodbye for now to Jordan.  He is going back to Korea for a little while and then to Germany for a year.  Me and the family (His and my best friends that is) are celebrating Thanksgiving early this year. I love always being included in another family because at times I view mine as being disfunctional- but that's just me.  I'm happy to be seeing both Jordan and Nicole.  I might also stop off at Wally World to see one of my friends there.  In any case- it will be a good time!  Next weekend I also have plans with Sara(my old roommate) to spend time with her and her family as we float down the river and look at all the leaves changing colors- that should be good times as well.  If you guys have anything coming up- you'll prolly have to give me a few weeks notice because it seems since last semester that the majority of my weekends get planned ahead of time so I'm always doing something with someone or I'm just visiting Chris and Jenn's.  Oh and our Homecoming I'd like to say is the first weekend in October- well that's all it for now.  Take care guys and all my love is being sent to you.

Hey guys and girls,

It's been awhile since I've wrotten in this thing so I decided to do a little update on the hectic thing that I call life.  I just got back from Vegas on September 11th and let me tell you things were hectic at the airport.  We did various things like going to shows, some gambling, shopping and the taste of the world.  I love Vegas but there are so many people spending so much money.  I wish I had more money that I could blow.  Oh, and I sorta went camera happy taking pictures at various casinos.  I actually hit all the big ones and walked the strip.  Good times.  It added to my mood when my friends called me from Wendy's party- that means at least some of you guys think about me when I'm not there.  Oh and before I left I hung out with my best friend.


Other than that.  Class is going well.  At times I think it will be difficult but I always end up managing.  Especially lately now that my personel life isn't crashing every few weeks.  I'll begin my internship on Monday which right now seems overwelming.  I'm in a group of 4 with 3 guys in my mgmt 449 class.  One of them I know because he's an econ major.  A good thing is they are the cutest guys in class- got to love eye candy.  There is another guy in my compensation mgmt class that remembers me from previous classes quite well- for some reason I always think that I'm invisible and nobody notices my presence.  I'll once again be tutoring for economics but at this time I'll be the only one.  That is flattering considering how many people could tutor and the economic department picked me.  I'm smiling inside.  Oh and apparently Jennifer Lee signed me up for shifts which one I can't and won't work (Friday night, Saturday morning) dream on.  I'll end up working monday night security- at least it will get me some money for food.

With all that going on, I'd like to mention I'm planning on being in the cities this wknd and if you guys want to see me- just let me know because I will be in town.  Well take care guys and keep in touch because you guys really do mean the world to me.

Well guys,
It's been awhile and there are a lot of things that have happened in that time.  For one, I am now a year older and had my Golden Birthday.  I absolutely loved that my closest friends were able to attend it with a few exceptions.  It was a night that went better then I could have hoped.  You guys always have a way of making a girl feel like she is the luckiest in the world.  I hope you enjoyed your stay in Tigerton and had a few laughs along the way.

Over summer, I was also able to hang out with my best friend since before kindergarden.  We have many momments that still astonish me.  She is the closest thing to family and it's almost like she is family.  I truly do love this girl although don't be twisting my words here.  There is hardly a time that we don't have fun overall.  It's funny how I'm always at the family events when even girlfriends and boyfriends of the family aren't there.  I don't even know where to start on telling stories about her.  Sad thing is I think we overdo drinking while together because it seems like we are always getting up on the bar.  We also have certain songs that we play over and over again.  Aparently when she went out this weekend she was asked by numerous people where her other half was.  She ends up making comments like "I complete her".  I sometimes wonder when we will ever settle down or stop being so out there- prolly in a few years.  Nicole ended up saying that it's best I go back to school because she is having too much fun and not concentrating on her studies enough.  It was also really sad saying goodbye to her for awhile- I almost started crying- but we still have the cell phone I suppose.

Then there is Walmart- I gained a lot of friends over the summer and it was hard to say goodbye to them too.  There was also some psychos but that is probably whereever you go and plus I need some stories to rattle off when I see you people.

Then there is the lovelife- it's complicated but not.  I am very happy that I wasn't attached to anybody from school.  I finally got to juggle guys and go on many different dates.  Although some assholes start rumors that get back to my family- Grrr.  I'd start writting about a couple of different guys- but it really hasn't played out and I don't know how it will go...  There will probably be good times to come and with at least one of them- I suppose I could see future potential- only time will tell.

Other than that- I have two very awesome roommates and I'm very happy with them.  I love all of you guys and I wish you the best.  Keep in touch.

It is so surprising how short life can really be.  We fret and talk about things that in the long run might not ever turn out to be anything.  Yesterday at Walmart a woman drove her truck into the wall and nearly hurt and possibly killed two other workers that I talk to on a regular basis.  It was lucky that they managed not to get hurt but it really makes you stop and think and even re-evaluate your life.  There are so many blessings that are bestowed on me but it could all be over tomorrow and that is quite a terrible thought.

I have been pretty happy all summer but I guess by checking my email today is what really got me down.  Joe Gapko died this July.  It's funny because I swear I just talked to him the friday before finals on what he was looking to do with his life.  Surprisingly we had the same internship lined up- he was doing it this summer and I was going to be doing it in the fall.  I had looked forward to speaking with him about it and he was always an interesting person to talk to but not it appears that that won't be happening and it's just a little bit depressing.  Joe is the first friend in college that has passed on and I just can't help but think how short life really is.  I don't think I can say if I died tomorrow that I have accomplished everything I wanted to do on this earth but then again- can anybody.  Anyways- this is getting super depressing so I should be going.

For those who don't know yet- I'm having my golden birthday party on August 26th.  Call for directions because I would love to see you all!

Well it seems like it's that time of summer for an update on my life.  Surprisingly I'm very happy.  Something I don't usually think.  I'm keeping in touch with as many of you as possible through the phone because I have limited internet access.  The past couple of summers I think I used it more mostly for one reason or another but mostly in the hopes of talking to a person.  The love life- I'm sorta seeing a few guys- nothing too serious yet.  I'll see if that changes.  Work- is surprisingly not that bad either- I have found a really good friend who when I'm with them- the time flies.  She says the same thing too.  We both usually don't get along with girls but we get along perfectly together.  I'm happy but also very busy so I should get going.  Take care my friends and remember you guys should come to my party the 26th of August to celebrate my Golden Birthday a few days late.

I got this emailed to me and I totally think that we should all read it and try to live life like this...

As we grow up, we learn that even the one person that wasn't supposed to 
ever let you down probably will. You will have your heart broken probably 
more than once and it's harder every time. You'll break hearts too, so 
remember how it felt when yours was broken. You'll fight with your best 
friend. You'll blame a new love for things an old one did. You'll cry 
because time is passing too fast, and you'll eventually lose someone you 
love. So take too many pictures, laugh too much, and love like you've 
never been hurt because eve ry sixty seconds you spend upset is a minute 
of happiness you'll never get back.

Don't be afraid that your life will end,
be afraid that it will never begin.

Tonight was another exciting weekend spent with the best friends a girl could ask for.  Ofcourse there was a few people I wish could have made it but that doesn't always happen.  My skydiving didn't take place because of weather conditions which sort of sucked but it did save me a lot of money.  I'm bummed but this too I shall get over.  I for the most part did well in all of my classes- there is only one I'm really nervous about.
Moving on- Ken- if you are reading this- I know we tend to bicker a lot but over the last three years- you have helped with issues such as uni and other things that I personally wanted to cry about.  It is fun to tease you and when you tease me back.  Next year will not be the same without you.  I know I sometimes devoulge too much info but then again I know about you too!  I hope to see you this summer and you are the only one that helped me stop by pinchy when I wanted to kill him.
Mark- It has been fun getting to know you as well.  You have one of the greatest girlfriends in the world and I wish you the best in the future.  Although I don't appreciate you pushing me onto girls.  Ootz.  I will miss you to- make sure to visit.
James- It's been a great time with you too.  You tend to be logical and know what to do even if I don't always follow your advice.  It has been interesting to see how you became less shy as time went by.  I hope you and Ingalls have a blast living together.
Jim- I hope you have an amazing time in Florida.  I'm sure you will do awesome and go onto do bigger and better things.  I guess I won't be seeing Conquest in my future anytime soon.
I think I covered most of the graduates that read this thing.  To everyone else that has graduated already.  It is not the same without you here.  It's like a big chunk of me keeps leaving and I'm stuck here.  However, me, Reyna, and Jack will be graduating in December and Eau Claire will become a memory.  I wish you all the best that life has to offer because you guys are the best and are the reason that helps me get up in the morning.  I know I usually don't say this in person because I don't like getting emotional.  Anywho- I did get a new Screen Name which I'm sure I will be contacting you  on because I love you guys.  It's going to be limited access so I do ask if I tell you it- you don't give it out.  I feel like an asshole blocking people and I'm not too sure who all has my SN already.
On another subject- the thing I learned the most this year was that of love.  The person you tend to love doesnt always share your same feelings.  I have stayed up many of nights crying over this fact- I have tried blocking this person out of my life too.  I just wish the pain would go away.  Maybe it's that I'm dwelling- but it's been 5 months and 11 days and it still feels like I got kicked in the stomach when I think of him which tends to be at this time.  It is his loss but that doesn't really make me feel any better.  I really don't understand how he can go through so many relationships and yet I shy away from them because of distance or the fear of being hurt again.  But what used to be love really turned into hate- I say I want him to find happiness but what I really meant was I wanted him to find happiness with me- if that makes sense.  I'd like to say we will actually be friends in the future but I'm sure you all know that won't happen anytime soon.  I guess the easiest thing to do is say goodbye and not answer emails or anything like that.  I have the opportunity to move on and some really great guys to move onto.  I feel bad for bad mouthing dave so much because you guys don't know him and what I have said will prolly make you never want to meet him.  However, he does have a side- I just dont know what it is and after this summer- I don't think I will care.  The one thing I look forward to is seeing my friend John who is going to set me up with a hot, single marine and it will be good times if I'm not in a relationship over this summer.
Ok- my rant is over- everybody have a great summer and keep in touch and I will be giving you my new SN shortly even though I don't have internet over the summer.

This school year is coming to an end.  This is a time of happiness but also a time of sadness.  Looking back on the last 4 years of my college career makes it seem like it past with a blink of an eye.  I experienced my first boyfriend, had my first heartbreak- not the same person, did my first keg stand and many other things.  Some of you got the chance to see me get up and dance on the bar at Brothers.  You guys have also been there when I told you stories that happened in my life- some more disturbing then others.  I thank you all for opening up and showing me a little bit of your lives as well.  It's surprising on the friendships that I have gained and retained and how first impressions don't always last.  The boys of 407 are graduating this semester along with a few other of my friends.  I thank all of you because you do make everyday a better one for me, by just being there.  We all have our moments and our friendships do get tested but in the end- it brings us closer to some and splits others.  I'll truly miss the people that are graduating along with not being able to see the people that have already graduated nearly enough.  I still have one more semester with the rest of you that are staying.  I'm excited and scared.  Then again- it might all be over for me next wknd because I'm going skydiving.  If this is the case- I have no regrets and I will die a happy person with a guy on my back.  I wish you all the best as always and don't let minor things ruin your mood.

Well, life is still good.  There isn't really that much drama although my best friend had me leave her at the bar again.  That didn't make me feel increadibly good but people will do what they want to do.  I also got to see 1/3 of my class- it was good times because I usually don't get to see them.
